patient_information: Age: 27 years Sex: male Travel history: 3.5 weeks in the rainforest of the Amazon Basin in northern Peru
chief_complaint: Persisting polyarthralgias after returning from a trip to the Peruvian Amazon
history_of_present_illness: Developed an acute febrile illness with chills, malaise, frontal headache, generalized myalgia and a transient, non-pruritic maculopapular rash during the second week of his stay in Peru. The affected joints did not reveal any clinical signs of inflammation (no swelling, no redness, no effusion).
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel to the Peruvian Amazon with a history of mosquito exposure.
vitals: Temperature: 39Â°C Heart rate: 80 bpm Respiratory rate: 16 breaths per minute Oxygen saturation: 98% Blood pressure: 120/80 mmHg
physical_exam: General appearance: Well-appearing male with no signs of inflammation in the affected joints. Skin: No rash or skin lesions present. Head and neck: No abnormalities detected. Chest: Clear breath sounds bilaterally. Abdomen: Soft, non-tender abdomen. Extremities: No swelling, redness, or effusion in the affected joints.
labs_and_diagnostics: Full blood count: Normal C-reactive protein: 9 mg/L (normal range: <5) Liver function tests: Normal
differential_diagnosis: {'diagnosis': 'Dengue fever', 'evidence': 'Acute febrile illness with chills, malaise, frontal headache, generalized myalgia and a transient, non-pruritic maculopapular rash. Dengue NS1 antigen positive on day 2.'}; {'diagnosis': 'Reactive arthritis', 'evidence': 'Symmetrical polyarthralgias primarily affecting the small peripheral joints after returning from a trip to the Amazon Basin of northern Peru. No clinical signs of inflammation in the affected joints.'}
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: Symptomatic treatment with paracetamol Clinical improvement: Fever and other symptoms subsided within 1 week, but polyarthralgias did not improve. Referral: Patient referred to a rheumatologist and subsequently to a tropical medicine clinic for evaluation of a putative travel-related cause of his polyarthralgias.
final_diagnosis: Diagnosis: Reactive arthritis Confirmation method: Symmetrical polyarthralgias primarily affecting the small peripheral joints after returning from a trip to the Amazon Basin of northern Peru. No clinical signs of inflammation in the affected joints. Evidence: No other causes identified through serological testing for dengue virus, chikungunya virus, parvovirus B19, Epstein-Barr virus, Borrelia burgdorferi, Chlamydia trachomatis, Salmonella Typhi, and S. Paratyphi.
